hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{20}$ flowers total.


And we know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD4$ vases.

The quotient will tell us the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$ is the $\purpleC{\text{number of flowers in each vase}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\purpleC{\text{number of flowers in each vase}}$.

question.content:
There are $20$ flowers. We want to divide them equally into $4$ vases. 

**What does the expression $20\div 4$ represent?**

choices.content: Number of flowers in each vase
